Content: 9 *p48355a0924* turn over       do not write in this area  do not write in this area  do not write in this area   (b) the coleoptiles with   radiation and without   radiation both increased in height  but those with   radiation were shorter.     using the results of this investigation, explain the effect of   radiation on the  height of the coleoptiles. (2)          *(c) examination of the coleoptiles with   radiation showed that there were fewer cells  in mitosis than there are in the coleoptiles without   radiation.      giving practical details, explain how you would compare the number of cells  undergoing mitosis in these coleoptiles.  (6)              (total for question 3 = 10 marks) physicsandmathstutor.com
